alert.note: Alert for West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 12:43PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Gunnison County through 115 PM MDT... At 1243 PM MDT, Doppler radar and satellite imagery were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Monarch Pass, or 32 miles east of Gunnison, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Satellite and Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Gunnison County, including the following locations... White Pine. This includes U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 191 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
